visualization_prompt: Generate a pie chart showing the distribution of global energy production sources using interactive legend toggling with user confirmation
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 10 categorical variables representing energy sources with quantitative percentage values. Synthetic data follows energy industry reports (IEA 2022 trends), maintaining realistic dominance hierarchies (coal > gas > renewables) while ensuring percentages sum to 100%. The pie chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating gridlines while maintaining Cairo's color contrast principles through distinct hue differentiation. Interactive legend toggling respects Tufte's minimalism by requiring explicit user confirmation. Statistical distribution (μ=10%, σ=12.3) reflects real-world energy market concentration, with coal (35%) and natural gas (25%) forming the primary cluster, while renewables show exponential growth patterns in smaller segments.
